title: üëâ Determinative Analysis of May 28 GBC Meeting with Srila Prabhupada üìúüîç
speaker: HDG Srila Prabhupada

segments.key_quote: So, in this video, let us get to the bottom of this.
segments.summary: The video introduces the debate surrounding the Rithvik system of initiation in ISKCON and the May 28th GBC meeting as a crucial piece of evidence.

segments.key_quote: Tamalkrishna Goswami knew that nobody in ISKCON was qualified to become Guru. And Srila Prabhupada also confirmed his statement.
segments.summary: The speaker highlights a conversation from April 1977 where Tamal Krishna Goswami and Srila Prabhupada discuss the lack of qualified gurus in ISKCON.

segments.key_quote: The key principle here is that to become guru, one must be ordered by one's guru.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes that a true guru must be ordered by their own guru, contrasting this with unauthorized or 'rubber-stamped' gurus.

segments.key_quote: Srila Prabhupada said, it is better to plan for the worst. And he called all the GBCs to come to Vrindavan.
segments.summary: The speaker describes Srila Prabhupada's declining health in May 1977 and his decision to call the GBC members to Vrindavan.

segments.key_quote: So we can see that all the five questions that were prepared by the GBC in that meeting on 28 May were all for the time after Srila Prabhupada left.
segments.summary: The speaker outlines the five questions the GBC members prepared for Srila Prabhupada, all concerning the period after his departure.

segments.key_quote: Even the question on how initiations were to be conducted in ISKCON were also for the future, when Prabhupada was not there with us.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes that the GBC's questions, including the one about initiations, were specifically for the time after Srila Prabhupada's physical presence.

segments.key_quote: When I order you become guru, he becomes regular guru. That's all.
segments.summary: The speaker presents the recording of the conversation related to the questions about initiation.

segments.key_quote: However, let us try to understand the meeting proceedings a little better.
segments.summary: The speaker begins to analyze the conversation, focusing on the claims made by supporters of self-authorized gurus based on Srila Prabhupada's statements.

segments.key_quote: If Shaila Prabhupada wanted them to become Gurus, he could have said that he is going to recommend some of them to act as Diksha Gurus or Gurus.
segments.summary: The speaker argues that Srila Prabhupada's intention was to appoint officiating Acharyas or Rithviks, not Diksha Gurus, and that the July 9th directive is not a temporary arrangement.

segments.key_quote: Shaila Prabhupada's reply to this question can be split into two.
segments.summary: The speaker begins to analyze the fourth question, noting its convoluted nature and splitting Srila Prabhupada's reply into two parts.

segments.key_quote: Without one's Guru's order, no one can become Guru.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the principle that no one can become a guru without the order of their own guru, as stated by Srila Prabhupada.

segments.key_quote: Prabhupada. They are his disciple.
segments.summary: The speaker analyzes the conversation further, highlighting Tamalkrishna Goswami's intervention to clarify the question about the disciples of the Rithvik Acharyas.

segments.key_quote: When I order you become Guru, he becomes regular Guru.
segments.summary: The speaker interprets Srila Prabhupada's response, suggesting that the disciples belong to the initiator (Srila Prabhupada) and that one only becomes a regular guru when ordered by Srila Prabhupada.

segments.key_quote: Prabhupada did not order anyone to become disciple of disciple or to become guru.
segments.summary: The speaker reiterates that Srila Prabhupada did not order anyone to become a disciple of a disciple or to become a guru, emphasizing the consistency of Srila Prabhupada's statements.

segments.key_quote: It is irrefutable that Srila Prabhupada appointed gurus or diksha gurus or acharyas. He only appointed officiating acharyas or rithwiks.
segments.summary: The speaker argues that even if there was confusion in the reply to question 4, the reply to question 3 was clear: they would be rithwiks, not diksha gurus, and that Srila Prabhupada's signature was essential on the minutes.

segments.key_quote: Tamalkrishna Goswami stalled, obstructed the demand to get Srila Prabhupada's signature on the GBC minutes.
segments.summary: The speaker describes how Tamalkrishna Goswami prevented Srila Prabhupada from signing the GBC minutes and emphasizes that the July 9, 1977 Directive is the clear instruction.

segments.key_quote: The newly initiated devotees are disciples of His Divine Grace who receives a letter from these representatives giving the spiritual name or the thread.
segments.summary: The speaker reads the July 9, 1977 Directive, highlighting that the newly initiated devotees are disciples of Srila Prabhupada.

segments.key_quote: Prabhupada is not well. Besides, I think he is busy. Let's not disturb him with this.
segments.summary: The speaker shares an interaction that happened on the Krishna Balram temple courtyard.

segments.key_quote: Tamalkrishna Maharaj was talking about the Ritwik gurus to initiate on behalf of Prabhupada after he leaves the planet.
segments.summary: The speaker shares an interaction that happened on the Krishna Balram temple courtyard.

segments.key_quote: The fact of the matter was, Srila Prabhupada made himself very clear on how new devotees coming into his movement were to be accepted into it after his disappearance.
segments.summary: The speaker shares an interaction that happened on the Krishna Balram temple courtyard.

segments.key_quote: Hence, the July 9th directive to carry out initiations in ISKCON is not some temporary order. It is the final order of Srila Prabhupada and ISKCON must follow it.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by emphasizing the crucial significance of the May 28th meeting and the July 9th directive, stating that the Rithvik system of initiation is the final order of Srila Prabhupada.
